text: I dont think there is anyway that there can't be.
If you have a chance you might want to check this out today: <https://ukie.org.uk/news/2020/03/ukie-student-conference-heads-twitch-friday-line-announced>
Oh thank you for the link! I found it on the UKIE twitter too, not going to have a chance to watch today unfortunately but will be watching on their youtube when they upload it

One thing I wanted to ask advice on - yesterday I formally launched something I'm calling GDSN - the game development student network. I'm essentially aiming to bridge connections between students from games related disciplines across the UK, as well as setting up some kind of talent-to-industry pipeline at one point. I have some further ideas for secondary and college education outreach but taking baby steps first. It's going well one day in but I'm wondering if you had any advice on maybe when the right time to reach out to companies to really bridge that connection?

This sounds like a good network and a good idea. Are you looking to connect students from other disciplines so they can work together, or is it more of communication thing help students grow a network.
If you’ve only just launched it. I would give it some time to breath. See how many people sign up/join  then decide on what the network is.
Once you have clear idea/message of what you’re trying to achieve then you can start reaching out to industry.
I'm lookingto connect students between disciplines and universities so they can work together yeah, but also just as a general networking tool for them for when they actually get into industry
Okay cool, I'm happy to wait and see how it grows, i've had two companies reach out and offer help already which is nice, all I had to do was post on my LinkedIn
Thats a good way to go about actually. Post about the network and see if anyone expresses interest. Then you can start reaching out to people directly later.
